title: Tell HMRC about a change of name or address

details.description: Send a secure online message to HM Revenue & Customs (HMRC) to report your change of name or address
details.more_information:
##Evidence
You'll need to provide various types of evidence, depending on what you want to tell HMRC and on your circumstances. You'll normally need at least one of the following:

* your current or last employer's name
* private or occupational pension details (the provider's name and the pension number)
* UTR (unique taxpayer reference) number if you're in Self Assessment - you can find it on your statements from HMRC 

%HMRC will update your details in various services, including PAYE (Pay As You Earn), National Insurance and Child Benefit - they will also tell the Government Gateway and the Pension Service.%

*[HMRC]: Her Majesty's Revenue & Customs
*[UTR]: unique taxpayer reference
*[PAYE]: Pay As You Earn
details.introduction:
You can tell HM Revenue & Customs (HMRC) about your change of name or address through their secure online service. Find out what service you need to use - this will depend on your circumstances.

*[HMRC]: HM Revenue & Customs
